channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12606] Sanity check encryption configuration before opening WAL or onlining regions
item.summary: Sanity check encryption configuration before opening WAL or onlining regions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Tell me what to do and I'll do up a patch Andrew Purtell

Wherever we are checking compression settings, we should add a checkEncryption (or similarly named..) method.

We should add a boolean verify() method to KeyProvider and implement it. Or call it check() if preferred. The function should return false if it thinks it's configuration hasn't been set up properly. Specifically, KeyStoreKeyProvider should return false if it can't find the path of the keystore file to load or cannot load the keystore from the path provided. The checkEncryption method should instantiate the configured KeyProvider, fail if that can't happen, or fail if the provider's verify() returns false. This should also be done in SecureProtobufWALReader/Writer initialization, although I suppose we are going to abort the server anyway if it can't create a WAL, at least we will do so in a way that's much clearer as to cause.

Then checkEncryption should look in HCD for any encryption setting. This will be a string like "AES" in . We can then use Encryption#getCipher to test if we can instantiate the configured algorithm, failing if we can't.
If you're not working on this I can take it stack

I'm poking around in IT tests trying to see what works and what doesn't. If you don't have time, just give me a prescription for what you'd do and I can do it else, if you can fix this, I'm sure you'd do it in less time than it would take me. Thanks Andrew Purtell

Attached patches check encryption configuration before opening WAL or onlining regions, and short circuit IntegrationTestIngestWithEncryption if distributed cluster configuration is missing prerequisites.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12685480/HBASE-12606.patch
against master branch at commit 1ec6609b978033550d4ead35de0ab5344b789bd1.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12685480

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 7 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 9 warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 2089 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 2088 errors).

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

Hmm, looks legit. Back later.

Checkstyle nit is this:

org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/EncryptionTest.java [HideUtilityClassConstructor]: Utility classes should not have a public or default constructor.

Will fix that.

Javadoc warnings aren't mine
Updated patch. Fixes checkstyle nit and reason for failed/zombie test.
Thats great Andrew Purtell What you think the cost of the check is? Much? +1 if hadoopqa passes.

This message is automatically generated.

This test failure is not related.

Latest checkstyle issue is "ExceptionUtil should be declared as final", which seems unnecessary to me so I'll bump up the expected number by 1 on commit.

The new check overhead should be fine. A real check is only done once for each provider and codec encountered and then the result is cached, like we do with compression.

Sorry I misread the checkstyle report on the phone screen. It's still "Utility classes should not have a public or default constructor." I thought I made the EncryptionTest constructor private. Will double check. If so I'll still need to bump up the expected number because this would be a false positive now.
Nope, missed the constructor change. One more patch forthcoming.

This message is automatically generated.
Precommit builds are looking a bit dirty. Going to commit this tomorrow but I will make sure a test suite run passes locally first.

All tests pass locally, and here's what happens if you try to run IntegrationTestIngestWithEncryption without setting up for encryption on the cluster:

apurtell@apurtell-ltm1:~/src/hbase-work$ ./bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestIngestWithEncryption

2014-12-06 21:11:19,721 WARN  [main] hbase.IntegrationTestIngest: Encryption configuration test did not pass, skipping test

apurtell@apurtell-ltm1:~/src/hbase-work$

What I committed.

For each branch in 0.98 branch-1 master:
– git checkout $branch
– mvn clean install -Dtest=*Encryption* -DskipITs: passed
– cd hbase-it && mvn verify -Dit.test=*Encryption*: passed
